alert.note: Alert for Kimble; Menard; Schleicher; Sutton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Schleicher, northwestern Kimble, southwestern Menard and northeastern Sutton Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 907 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Fort Mckavett, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Fort Mckavett, Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line and Cleo. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 446 and 453. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
